section.title: Manage Content In Content Explorer
section.para: A web content is a key resource in creating a site. Other resources make a site more dynamic and animated by using layout, color, font, and more. This section focuses on how to manage a web content in a specific site.

note.para: Only users who have the right to access the Sites Management drive can manage web content.

section.title: Create a new web content
section.para: This function is used to add a new web content into a specific site.

step.para: Go to the Sites Management drive and select a site that you want to add a web content to.
Select the web content folder on the left:

note.para: You also can add the new web content into other folders (documents and media folder) of a site but it is recommended that you add new content to the web content folder because:

listitem.para: It will allow you to manage web content of a site more easily.
If you add a new web content in this folder, you don't need to select a web content document in the list of document types. This makes adding a new web content more flexible.

step.para:
Open the Add New Document form by clicking the
Add Document
icon on the Action bar.
Select a template in the Select Template field to present web content:
The Select Template field has two options:

listitem.para: Picture on head layout web content: The site's content is presented in two spaces. One for inserting an image and one for editing the site's content. In which, the image is put at the head of a site.
Free layout web content: This template is a free layout.

step.para: Enter values in the fields of the Add New Document form.
Click Save as Draft to save the content or Cancel to exit the form.

step.title: Tabs in the Add New Document form
step.para: The Main Content Tab includes:

row.entry: The name of a web content that you want to add new
The title of a web content
The main content that you want to display when publishing this web content

step.para: The Illustration Tab allows you to upload an illustration that makes the site's content more attractive.

row.entry: The path to an image that you want to upload into a site. This image will be used like an illustration of that site.
The image format that you want to upload to the site. It can be: image/gif; image/png; image/jpg; image/jpeg.

You can supply a short description about the web content that will be displayed with the illustration image when the web content is listed. The main content will be shown when it is selected to be viewed.

step.para: Do the following to upload an image:
Browse an image list on your local device by clicking the Browse... button and then select a specific location.
Select an image in the list to upload.
The Advanced tab:
This tab includes two parts: CSS data and JS data:

row.entry: Contains CSS definition to present data in a web content. You can optionally enter CSS data into this field to specify the style.
Contains JS content to make the web content more dynamic when after publishing. You can optionally enter JS content in this field.

section.title: Edit a web content
section.para: This function is used to edit a web content in a specific drive of an existing site.

step.para: Go into the folder of a site which contains the web content that you want to edit.
Select the web content by double-clicking it on the left tree or on the right panel. The detailed information of web content will be viewed on the right panel.

Click the
Edit Document
icon on the action bar to show the edit form of the selected web content as the Add New Document form.
Change the current values in the fields of this edit form.
Complete editing the selected web content by clicking Save.

note.title: Auto-lock
note.para: When you click Edit Document, the web-content will be auto-locked for editing. After finishing, the content reverts to unlocked status. You can manage Locks in the Administration portlet.

section.title: Delete a web content
section.para: This function is used to remove a web content from the web content folder in a specific site's drive.
To delete a web-content, do the following:

step.para: Right-click the name of the web content that you want to delete and then select Delete in the drop-down menu:
A confirmation message will appear. Click OK to accept the deletion, or Cancel to quit without deleting.

section.title: Publish a web content
section.para: This function helps you publish a web content that you have added to web content folder in Content Explorer.
See to know how to publish a web content.
After the content is published, all users who have the right to access that position can view the published web content as a page on the Navigation bar.
